alert.note: Alert for Northern Gila County; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued March 14 at 2:35AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: .Heavy rain may fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers may increase quickly and reach critical levels. ...FLOOD WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is possible. * WHERE...Portions of central Arizona, including the lower elevations of Yavapai County and northern Gila County. * WHEN...From Wednesday morning through Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...Flooding will be possible in creeks, normally dry washes, and swimming holes. Low-water crossings could also experience flooding, which would create deadly travel conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Periods of heavy rainfall are expected to develop across the region starting Wednesday and lasting into early Thursday. The rain combined with snow melt, will lead to significant runoff into area waterways. With many waterways south of the Mogollon Rim already seeing elevated flow, several locations may approach or exceed flood stage. The greatest chances for flood exist within the Oak Creek, Sycamore Creek, Beaver Creek, and Verde River basins. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Northern Gila County; Oak Creek and Sycamore Canyons; Yavapai County Valleys and Basins
